cards.character

Class Character

  • java.lang.Object
    • cards.Card
      • cards.character.Character
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Character>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Architect, Assassin, Bishop, Condottiere, King, Magician, Thief, Trader

    public abstract class Character
extends Card
implements java.lang.Comparable<Character>
    Abstraction of a character and his attributes. A character is a card so the class extends the Card class.
    Author:
    bpotiron

    • Field Detail

      • rank

    • Constructor Detail

      • Character

        Character(java.lang.String name,
          Family family,
          java.lang.String description,
          int rank)
        Constructor of a character which call the constructor of a card.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the character
        family - the family affiliate to the character (null if the character is not affiliate to a family)
        description - Description of the power of the character
        rank - the rank in the game of the character. The rank is used to know the position of the character in the game. Two characters can't have the same rank.

    • Method Detail

      • getDescription

        public java.lang.String getDescription()
        Getter for the description of the character
        Returns:
        the description of the character

      • setDescription

        public void setDescription(java.lang.String description)
        The setter of the description of the character
        Parameters:
        description - corresponding to the description of the powers of the character

      • getRank

        public int getRank()
        Getter for the rank of the character
        Returns:
        the rank of the character in the game (for example the assassin is number 1 and the condottiere is number 8)

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Character o)
